definition:
An incidence geometry $A=(P,n,I)$ is a *linear ordered geometry* if
there is a strict betweenness relation $B$ defined on the points $P_0$
of $A$, such that

-   $(p,q,r)\in B$ only if $p,q$, and $r$ are collinear (all incident
    with a common line $\ell\in P_1$);

-   for any pairwise distinct collinear points $p,q,r$, at least one of
    $(p,q,r)$, $(q,r,p)$, or $(r,p,q)\in B$,

We denote the linear ordered geometry by $(A,B)$.\
